page.title: 02St.Nicholas', Shepperton.
page.content: The church of St.Nicholas was built in 1614, constructed of previously used materials. The oblong brick tower was built in 1710. The church's seats are called box pews. A previous Rector of Shepperton was the famous poet Thomas Love Peacock. There are six bells in the church. The first bell was taken down in 1877 and five new bells were installed and 60 years later the bells were retuned. The present church is 317 years old. The old church was situated at the site of the present river. It was destroyed during a flood.
